questions.question: They ………………………… a deep pit.
questions.description: Dig is an irregular verb. Its past form is dug.

questions.question: She has always been …………………………. towards animals.
questions.description: Drawn is the past participle form of draw.

questions.question: Don’t drive if you are …………………………….
questions.description: Drunk is the past participle form of drink.

questions.question: We were …………………………….. by the rain.
questions.description: Driven is the past participle form of drive.

questions.question: I ………………………….. the cats before I went out.
questions.description: Fed is the past simple form of feed.

questions.question: We ……………………………… above hills and valleys.
questions.description: Flew is the past simple form of fly.

questions.question: She …………………………….. suspicious.
questions.description: Grew is the past simple form of grow.

questions.question: They ……………………………. the painting on the wall.
The treasure lay …………………………… for centuries.
I was badly ……………………………..
questions.description: Hurt is the past simple and past participle form of hurt.

questions.question: She ……………………………. the mirror against the wall.
They ………………………….. the lamp.
Smoking cigarettes ……………………….. injurious to health.
questions.description: Here the subject is the gerund smoking. Gerunds are treated as singular.

questions.question: ……………………… stand there.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are in the simple present tense. Since the subject is you, use a plural verb.

questions.question: ……………………… this file with you.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are in the simple present tense. Since the subject is you, use a plural verb.

questions.question: She ………………………. younger than she actually is.
questions.description: She is a singular subject, so use the verb looks. We use the simple present to talk about people's apperances.

questions.question: There ………………………….. be a tall mango tree in that corner.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past states. Would cannot be used to express this meaning.

questions.question: She asked me what I …………………………. doing there.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, use a past tense verb in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: She ………………………… in a factory.
questions.description: We normally use the simple present to talk about people's jobs. The present continuous is used to talk about temporary arrangements.

questions.question: We ………………………… hiking yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: I ……………………………. a worse experience than this.
questions.description: The present perfect is more appropriate here.

questions.question: Does anybody ………………………….. who she is?
questions.description: Use the bare infinitive after do, does and did.

questions.question: I knew I …………………………… a mistake.
If I were you, I …………………………….. this.
questions.description: In type 2 conditional, use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + bare infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: Their first child ............................... in
questions.description: The past tense is always used to express this idea.

questions.question: I ................................ my first car many years ago.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: She ............................. in Madrid when she was a child.
questions.description: The simple past is used to say when something happened.

questions.question: When I ..................................... he ........................... in the garage.
questions.description: The simple past is used for the short action that happens in the middle of the longer background action.

questions.question: As I ................................ up the stairs, I ............................. a scream from one of the rooms.
questions.description: The simple past is used for the short action that happens in the middle of the longer background action.

questions.question: Smallpox .................................. millions of people before it ....................................
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about a finished event in the past. The passive form is used to fill in the second blank because small pox is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: I .................................. for your drinks.
questions.description: Paid is the past form of pay. The present perfect is used to talk about finished events that are in some way related to the present.

questions.question: Between three and six I ...................................
questions.description: The past continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that was going on at a particular point of time in the past.

questions.question: I ............................... you .......................... lend me a few pounds.
questions.description: Past tenses are used to make requests sound more polite.

questions.question: The man complained that he ………………………….
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we need a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: She asked me if she ………………………….. use my laptop.
questions.description: Could is the past tense of can. When the main verb is in the past tense, we need a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: I want to know why you ………………………. to me.
questions.description: Use do with you. In the simple present tense, we make questions and negatives with do and does.

questions.question: I waited for hours but she …………………………….
If you ………………………. a little faster, you could overtake her.
questions.description: In type 2 conditional, we use a simple past in the if-clause and would/could / might + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: It is time you …………………………… blaming others for your failures.
questions.description: After it is time, a past tense is used with a present or future meaning.

questions.question: I wish I ……………………………. fly.
What will you do if you …………………………….. that job?
questions.description: In type 1 conditional, we use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will / can / may + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: By next September, I …………………………… in this college for twenty years.
questions.description: We use the future perfect to say that an activity will have completed by a certain point of time in future.

questions.question: I asked her what she …………………………. there.
We ………………………….. the job by next Monday.
He ………………………….. ill for two months, before he died.
questions.description: Perfect tenses are more common with the time expressions for and since. We use the past perfect to talk about the earlier of two past events.

questions.question: It ………………………. not take me more than 10 minutes to get ready.
questions.description: Use does with it. Has is used with the past participle forms of the verb.

questions.question: ……………………… leave now.
questions.description: In the simple present tense we make negatives and questions with do and does.

questions.question: ………………………… at once.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences.

questions.question: When I was young I …………………….. walk 10 miles in an hour.
questions.description: Use could to talk about past ability.

questions.question: They ………………………… live in a caravan.
questions.description: Would cannot refer to past states only used to can refer to past states.

questions.question: The old woman ………………………… spend hours talking to herself.
questions.description: Would and used to can both be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: Once upon a time, there ………………………. a pretty girl.
questions.description: Use past tenses in story telling.

questions.question: I cannot let go ………………………. him.
They gave ………………………. without any resistance.
questions.description: To give in is to surrender.

questions.question: A powerful earthquake ……………………….. the city yesterday.
questions.description: Use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: I ………………………. them before.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with before.

questions.question: I didn’t realize that I ……………………… a mistake.
questions.description: When the main verb is the past tense, use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: If he ……………………. like this, he will have an accident one of these days.
questions.description: Use a simple present tense in the if-clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause to talk about real and possible situations.

questions.question: She said that she ……………………….. never forget me.
questions.description: Would is the past form of will. When the main clause is in the past tense, the subordinate clause too should be in the past tense.

questions.question: I don’t know where she …………………………
Though we played well, we …………………………. win the match.
questions.description: Could not shows past inability.

questions.question: She accused me of ………………………… her letters.
questions.description: A verb used after a preposition should be in its ing form.

questions.question: I couldn’t remember if I ……………………… the door.
She told me …………………….. lost.
questions.description: Imperative sentences are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: My parents always encouraged me …………………………. big.
questions.description: Encourage is followed by object + to infinitive.

questions.question: I waited for hours but no one ………………………..
If you had been more careful, the accident ……………………………..
She insisted that I …………………………. her.
questions.description: This is an example of a subjunctive. Either go or should go is possible here.

questions.question: I would rather you …………………………. calling me.
questions.description: We use a past tense after would rather to refer to present or future.

questions.question: I ................... a discussion with my boss in the morning.
questions.description: In the morning usually refers to past time hence, the simple past is preferred with it.

questions.question: They ...................... to our proposal.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used to announce news.

questions.question: Nobody knows how he .................... from the prison.
The ship has ……………………………….
questions.description: People drown ships sink.

questions.question: When I talked to her I realized that she ....................... depressed
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we usually use past tenses in the subordinate clauses as well.

questions.question: I ..................... to him since our last meeting.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about time up to now.

questions.question: I .................... out every day.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habits, routines etc.

questions.question: Neither the manager nor his secretary ...................... present in the office.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: The quality of life in urban areas ......................... deteriorating.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun quality.

questions.question: Even the mightiest .................... prey to death.
questions.description: The mightiest is a plural expression.

questions.question: He ...................... here a moment ago.
The song ……………………… on an old folk tune.
The farmer ………………………. when he bought a barren cow.
questions.description: The farmer didn't cheat. Someone cheated him. Hence, we need the passive verb form here.

questions.question: The balloon ………………………. with a bang.
questions.description: Burst is the past tense of burst.

questions.question: Good posture ………………………… from holding the backbone straight.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: Abraham Lincoln …………………………. from an impoverished background.
questions.description: We use the simple past to say that something happened in the past.

questions.question: Bacteria ………………………… in the air we breathe and in the food we eat.
questions.description: Bacteria is a plural noun bacterium is the singular form.

questions.question: The actress ………………………… for her babyish temper tantrums.
Everyone …………………………….. aware of the dangers of smoking.
He said that he ………………………… for Alice.
questions.description: A past verb is used after a past reporting verb.

questions.question: He said that he ………………………… a job.
questions.description: A present perfect in the direct speech will become past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: She said that she …………………………. for ages.
questions.description: A present perfect continuous in the direct speech will become past perfect continuous in the indirect speech.

questions.question: He said that he ……………………….. meat.
We had a press pass but ………………………… refused admittance anyhow.
As he ………………………. older, his mind regressed further into the past.
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about two past events that took place simultaneously.

questions.question: I ………………………… any regrets over anything I have ever done.
questions.description: Either don't have or have never had is possible here.

questions.question: She was made …………………………. the whole story.
questions.description: Made is followed by a to-infinitive in passive structures.

questions.question: Reading books ……………………….. a good hobby.
questions.description: Here the subject is the ing form reading ing forms are treated as singular.

questions.question: Suma as well as her sisters ……………………….. at the party.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: John along with his friends ……………………….. in that house.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with 'along with', the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Do you know where ………………………?
questions.description: In indirect questions, the verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: Scarcely …………………………. one project before she started another.
questions.description: Either had she finished or did she finish is correct here.

questions.question: ‘You look tired.’ ‘Yes, I …………………………’
Each guest ………………………. welcomed with open arms.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after each.

questions.question: Every student …………………….. handed in their work.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after every.

questions.question: …………………….. she know what she is doing?
questions.description: She is singular subject. Hence, we use does here.

questions.question: ……………………… forget to give me a call before you leave.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences. In imperatives the subject is you.

questions.question: ………………………… your shoes before entering the temple.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentence.

questions.question: She ……………………………. harder than anybody I know.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about facts.

questions.question: He was a true patriot who …………………….. for his country.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: I …………………………… my grandparents every Sunday.
Sam ………………………. a good job.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to give news.

questions.question: We ………………………… the job by Monday.
Don’t phone them now. They …………………………. dinner.
She ………………………. to him for thirty years.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about life experiences up to now.

questions.question: Somebody has ……………………… my purse?
questions.description: Stolen is the past participle of steal.

questions.question: She ………………………….. to anyone.
He ……………….. the pictures on the wall.
questions.description: Hung is the past tense of hang when it means be suspended from above.

questions.question: The man was ………………….. for murder.
questions.description: When hang means to kill someone by hanging, its past tense is hanged.

questions.question: I ……………………. him a moment ago.
questions.description: The present perfect is not used with the time expression ago.

questions.question: He ………………….. in
questions.description: The present perfect is not used with past time expressions.

questions.question: He ………………….. ill for about a month.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: He lost his phone shortly after he ………………………… it.
questions.description: The simple or the past perfect is possible here.

questions.question: I …………………….. you for a long time.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I ……………………… him to go.
questions.description: Before a personal object, use tell.

questions.question: Neither of the messengers ……………………….. returned.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: The quality of the apples ………………………… not good.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun quality.

questions.question: One of my sisters ………………………. abroad.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun one.

questions.question: The mother cat with her kittens …………………………. hiding under the bed.
questions.description: When we connect two subjects with 'with', the verb agrees with the first subject in number.

questions.question: I …………………. him yesterday.
questions.description: The present perfect cannot be used with past time expressions.

questions.question: We …………………. to the park last week.
You must ……………………. the instructions.
questions.description: To listen to is to pay attention to hear.

questions.question: Always …………………. the truth.
Her dad died two years ……………………
questions.description: Ago is used to count from a present moment to a past moment.

questions.question: I …………………. that movie last night.
I …………………… to the boss about my holiday.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, the present perfect is more commonly used to talk about finished events.

questions.question: He was …………………… for murder.
questions.description: The past tense of hang is hanged when we are talking about killing someone by hanging.

questions.question: He …………………… the pictures on the wall.
He …………………… under the tree.
questions.description: When lie means to recline, its past tense is lay.

questions.question: I heard them ........................... in the other room.
questions.description: Hear is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He reached the station after the train ……………………..
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: The school ……………………… in September.
questions.description: The simple present is sometimes used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: I will call the police if you ……………………. at once.
questions.description: The simple present is often used in subordinate clauses with a future meaning.

questions.question: ……………………. we report this?
questions.description: Shall is used when asking for instructions.

questions.question: ……………………….. you help me with the homework?
questions.description: Will is used in requests for help.

questions.question: The train ……………………… at
questions.description: The simple present is sometimes used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: By next January, I ……………………….. for fifteen years.
questions.description: The future perfect continuous is used to say that something will have been completed by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: I promise I ……………………….. you my money back.
questions.description: Will is used in promises.

questions.question: Let’s go somewhere quiet, …………………………. we?
questions.description: We use shall in question tags after let’s.

questions.question: You ……………………… never …………………….. me with anything.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used with the expressions ever, never, already etc.

questions.question: I ………………………… with a minor accident yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: He …………………….. all his life in his native village.
My friend ………………………….. for about a month.
questions.description: Use the present perfect to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: He said that he …………………………………. her last year.
questions.description: The past perfect is used to talk about the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: I ………………………………… my work before he came to see me.
questions.description: The past perfect is not exactly necessary to indicate that an action had finished before another action commenced. We can express the same idea using the conjunctions before and after.

questions.question: He ………………………….. before his mother arrived.
questions.description: The past perfect is not exactly necessary to indicate that an action had finished before another action commenced. We can express the same idea using the conjunctions before and after.

questions.question: The show ……………………………. before we reached the venue.
questions.description: The past perfect is not exactly necessary to indicate that an action had finished before another action commenced. We can express the same idea using the conjunctions before and after.

questions.question: He ………………………………. his wealth shortly after he ………………………………. it.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of the two actions the simple past is used for the later action.

questions.question: When I reached there I found that the tiger ……………………………….
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of the two actions.

questions.question: He lost his temper before I ……………………………… a word.
My friend …………………………….. in Mumbai since
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use present perfect or present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: He ………………………………. for you since 8 o’clock.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use present perfect or present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: I ……………………………. to school by bus.
questions.description: We use the simple present tense to talk about habits, routines etc.

questions.question: I …………………………….. him to go.
questions.description: We say tell before a personal object.

questions.question: James as well as his friends ………………………….. guilty.
questions.description: When you connect two subjects with as well as, the verb agrees with the first subject.

questions.question: Neither Martha nor Jennifer ……………………….. there.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with neither/nor, the verb agrees with the number and person of the second subject.

questions.question: One of the students ……………………………. missing.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: Neither of them ……………………………. hard.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: Either you or he …………………………… telling a lie.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with either/or, the verb agrees with the number and person of the second subject.

questions.question: These cattle ……………………………. to my grandmother.
questions.description: Cattle is plural.

questions.question: He always ……………………………….. fault with others.
He …………………………… smoke.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.

questions.question: I …………………………. him to go.
questions.description: Before a personal object, we use tell.

questions.question: He …………………………… to come.
The council ………………………….. of 12 members.
She ran with quick steps to the house when it …………………………. raining.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: It was so quiet you ………………………. hear a pin drop.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: Susie ……………………………. with her sister.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about permanent situations.

questions.question: She ……………………………… in the film industry for fifteen years by next year.
questions.description: The future perfect continuous is used to say that something will have been completed by a certain point of time in the future.

questions.question: The patient …………………………… before the doctor arrived.
questions.description: The past perfect is used to talk about the earlier of the two past actions.

questions.question: I …………………………………… this with him when he came here the other day.
questions.description: The past perfect is used to talk about the earlier of the two past actions. The simple past is also possible here.

questions.question: When I was young, I .................................... play football a lot.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.

questions.question: She ...................................... next month.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about pre-planned future events.

questions.question: A good citizen ……………………………. all his financial obligations.
He …………………………. in this office for ten years now.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: You ……………………………… me you weren’t coming
questions.description: Could have + past participle can be used to criticize people for not doing things.

questions.question: If a sinner …………………………… penitence, he can be forgiven.
I .................................. live there when I was younger.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.

questions.question: She .................................... yesterday.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: He ..................................... homeless since he left his native place.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: I ........................................ in Europe when I was a kid.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: He .......................................... another home last month.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: She ...................................... another car.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, we use the present perfect to talk about finished events.

questions.question: James ................................... his leg. He can't go to work.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about a past event whose effect is still felt in the present.

questions.question: I ..................................... my knee while playing cricket yesterday.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: Thieves ......................................... into their home while they were sleeping in the patio.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: We ........................................ them since January.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: The government …………………….. a consumer protection agency last month.
questions.description: To simply state that something happened sometime ago, we use the simple past.

questions.question: The university ……………………… to establish an institute for Asian studies.
The institution of slavery ………………………… once widespread.
questions.description: Use the simple past for finished past events.

questions.question: She ………………………… that she heard someone in the house.
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too will most probably be in the past tense.

questions.question: The auditor …………………………. the books every month.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about routines, habits, facts etc.

questions.question: A fair and kind employer …………………………. loyalty.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about facts and general truths.

questions.question: Everyone ……………………………. as an individual.
When we got talking I found out that we …………………………. at school together twenty-five years before.
questions.description: Before is often used with a past perfect to count back from a past moment.

questions.question: My mom has a strange accent. She almost ………………………… foreign.
I will call you before I …………………….
questions.description: When the main verb is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: He ……………………….. school when he was twelve.
You ……………………………. me you were not coming.
questions.description: Could have + past participle is used to criticize people for not doing things in the past.

questions.question: I saw him ................................ the money.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after see.

questions.question: Yesterday I .............................. a new phone as my old one .................................. stolen.
questions.description: We use the past perfect for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: They ..................................... a house in Delhi two months ago.
Ever since I .................................... my home, I ...................................... living here.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about actions or situations that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: She usually .................................. white clothes.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habits.

questions.question: I heard her ………………………………… in the next room.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after hear.

questions.question: It’s time you …………………………………. that coat.
questions.description: We use a past tense after it’s time to refer to the present.

questions.question: He was ………………………………….. in the battle.
questions.description: Wounded is the past tense of wound.

questions.question: I think you .................................. consult a doctor.
questions.description: The expression I think you should is used to make polite suggestions.

questions.question: Let's buy some flowers for her, .....................................?
questions.description: Shall is used in question tags after let.

questions.question: I don't mind .................................... the housework.
questions.description: We use an ing form after I don't mind.

questions.question: I don't like ........................................... up early in the morning.
questions.description: Like is followed by an infinitive.

questions.question: ........................................ I get you something to drink?
questions.description: Shall I is used in polite offers to do something.

questions.question: ............................................. you like me to type your letters for you?
Would you mind if I ...................................... some music?
questions.description: We use a past tense after would you mind...?

questions.question: I'm not really into films. I would rather ..................................... a book.
questions.description: Would rather is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: John ..................................... ten minutes ago.
questions.description: We use the past simple to say when something happened.

questions.question: We were having lunch when someone ......................................... on the floor.
questions.description: The past simple is used to talk about the short action that happened in the middle of the long action.

questions.question: He did not allow me ……………………….
questions.description: We use a to-infinitive after allow.

questions.question: The injured woman ………………………….. to hospital.
questions.description: We need a passive verb form here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: We ……………………………… anything from them yet.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with the time expressions already and yet.

questions.question: The chief guest ………………………………… arrived.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with the time expressions already and yet.

questions.question: ‘Let me ………………………….,’ the boy cried.
questions.description: We use an infinitive without to after let.

questions.question: The birds …………………………….. when I woke up this morning.
questions.description: We use the past continuous to talk about an action or situation that was going on a particular point of time in the past.

questions.question: I heard them ……………………………..
questions.description: We use a gerund or an infinitive without to after the verbs see and hear.

questions.question: I saw him …………………………….. the road.
Yesterday I …………………………….. an English movie.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about finished past events.

questions.question: The constable asked me what …………………………….. doing there.
questions.description: The subject goes before the verb in an indirect question.

questions.question: I ……………………………. like to get up early in the morning.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about our likes and dislikes.

questions.question: Ever since I ………………………….. my native place I ………………………………. here.
questions.description: We use the simple past for finished actions or situations in the past. We use the present perfect continuous to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.
